demo_DXCP.jobs package¶

demo_DXCP.jobs.jobs module¶

class demo_DXCP.jobs.jobs.dxcp_phat(*args, id=None, **kwargs)¶

Bases: shared.jobs.jobs.LoggingJob

The core computation of the overlay network

Attributes:

Inst_DXCPPhaT {DXCPPhat} – Instance of DXCPPhat

init_job()¶

Implement this method as a normal __init__ method, but wihtout the call to the super class. Use it to hand over parameters from the config to your job.

run_job(input0, input1)¶

Execution of the job

Arguments:

input0 {np_array} – Samples of the first audio track input1 {arraylike} – Samples of the second audio track

Returns:

tuple – first element SROppm_est_out, second element TimeOffsetEndSeg_est_out

setup_job()¶

Setups all attributes before executing the job

class demo_DXCP.jobs.jobs.print_results(*args, id=None, **kwargs)¶

Bases: shared.jobs.jobs.LoggingJob, fission.core.jobs.LocalJob

Sink job of the overlay network Stores the results in an .txt file

init_job()¶

Implement this method as a normal __init__ method, but wihtout the call to the super class. Use it to hand over parameters from the config to your job.

run_job(input0, input1)¶

Execution of the Job

Arguments:

input0 {float} – SROppm_est_out input1 {float} – TimeOffsetEndSeg_est_out

setup_job()¶

Setups all attributes before executing the job

class demo_DXCP.jobs.jobs.read_data(*args, id=None, **kwargs)¶

Bases: shared.jobs.jobs.LoggingJob

Source Job of the DXCP overlay network. Reads in a soundfile and sends it divided into packets via the output pipes

Attributes:

soundfile_path {str} – Describes the path to the soundfile that should be read samples_per_packet {int} – The number of samples that are sended in one packet self.data_read {bool} – self.end {bool} – self.sample_counter {int} – self.x {np.array} – self.nr_samples {int} –

init_job(soundfile_path, samples_per_packet=2048)¶

Initializes the Job.

Arguments:

soundfile_path {str} – Describes the path to the soundfile that should be read

samples_per_packet {int} – Sets the number of samples that are sended in a packet (default: {2048})

run_job()¶

Execution of the job Has no inputs since it is a source job

setup_job()¶

Setups all attributes before executing the job
